alert.note: Alert for Coweta; Heard; Troup (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 1:12PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Heard, northern Troup and southwestern Coweta Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 112 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Big Springs, or 10 miles west of Franklin, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Hogansville, Centralhatchee, Corinth, Waresville, Frolona, Texas, Plant Wansley, Harrisonville, Glenn, Powers Crossroads and Handy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
